We have in place solid relationships and good communication with overseas suppliers to provide us with bulk material in a timely fashion. Our goal is to hire more people in the USA and support our economy. We have already received inquiries of ordering 10,000 or more!

Let's celebrate! We believe in giving back. When we hit our goal with Indiegogo, we want to donate ties and $500 to www.swsorganization.org, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the quality of life and access of resources for families and youth.
Are you ready to be a part of the Knot Brothers Brotherhood? Check out our selection of ties at www.knotbrothers.com 

Once you select the perfect knot package for you, we will email you asking which tie(s) and color(s) you desire.
Thank you for all your support!
Evan Peterson

story:
How often have you went to a leading brand and you notice you are spending a killing? We understand the elitist concept of luxury, but in a changing world, why hasn't that idea been shattered as yet? We have all gone to a store and absolutely fallen in love with that leather handbag- and it's so expensive because it's leather, right? Wrong- statistically, we pay more than three times over for items bought in popular stores, our money going towards almost every overhead they have, campaigns, and still not affecting the already ridiculous profit margin. Veritas Clothing, has come to shatter those notions, once and for all.

We just need a little help from passionate people who share our vision. Leading brands tend to retail mass-produced clothes, and sell them for truly one-of-a-kind pricing. Prices that should give you the right to be the only one in the world to own that item. If only. So here at Veritas Clothing we provide handmade luxury apparel, and provide them to you. Instead of having a luxury brand purchase mass produced items and then retail them, we go ahead and we handmake each item for your enjoyment!

Veritas Clothing's is dedicated to embracing the amazing diversity and unique sense of fashion each person has to offer. Our mission is to provide luxury apparel for each woman, and to meet what she is looking for, whether it be fit, comfort or style, in an atmosphere that is comfortable, exciting and satisfying. We understand the frustration women across the world experience when there seems to be no variety in the fashion atmosphere. We cannot afford to be stifled by dictated 'styles' or rising prices of uniform items. We literally cannot afford it- not as one entity. That's why we sought to solicit your help to tackle such a common problem most of us face.

The right mix of products has previously been identified as one of the keys to success for Veritas Clothing.  The importance of delivering products that meet the needs and desires of our customers can not be underestimated. 

Veritas Clothing will carry quality European and U.S. products with the added Caribbean flavor that the market seems to be pointing towards; apparel that are unique to the  market. 

Read More


We need $3,500 USD to start changing the market. We plan to make luxury womenswear all the more cheaper. We also plan to destroy the idea of 'Plus Sizes' and so we feature 'Positive Sizes' which are for curvaceous women who are positive about their bodies and are more than happy to be beautiful in their bodies!

#NoMorePlusSize

We would love to be featured in blogs, and press releases. We are aiming to change the media, and to do that we need publicity.

It's in the name- We are the truth.

story:
La Projekto.

Tra la monda historio, la sporto montris la forton de ĉiu granda komunumo, pri tio temas ĉi tiu revo. Ni volas pruvi ke la Esperanto-komunumo estas konstruita sur fortaj kaj stabilaj fundamentoj. Ni kredas ke Esperanto meritas havi futbalan selektitaron kaj fakte ni havas bonegajn novaĵojn por vi.....
Ni jam havas futbalan selektitaron! Nia membriĝo jam estis sukcese aprobita de la NF-Board!!!! JES, la Esperanto-movado pere de "T.E.F.A" estas jam oficiale monda rekonata futbala asocio!

La Esperanto-selektitaro jam ludis matĉon dum la 99-a UK en Bonaero sed ne povis esti konsiderata "oficiala matĉo inter selektitaroj". Do, nia unua oficiala matĉo okazos dum la 100-a Universala Kongreso de Esperanto en Lillo. Mojosega koincido, ĉu ne?

Nia kontraŭulo estos la forta teamo de Okcidenta Saharo, kaj malgraŭ tiu ke ankoraŭ estas kelkaj solvendaĵoj, kiel ekzemple la stadiono kie la matĉo okazos, jam ĉio estas certa kaj neniu povos malhelpi ke nia selektitaro komencu sian historion.

Kaj la afero iĝas eĉ pli interesa! TEFA komencis negocii por povi organizi ĉiujaran eventon (dum ĉiu UK) kadre de kiu oni ofertus pokalon de interpopola frateco nomitan POKALO ZAMENHOF, kiu iĝus simbolo de la unuiĝo de la popoloj per futbalo kaj Esperanto.

Jen la revo por kiu ni laboras ĉiun tagon kaj por kiu ni petas ke vi helpu, eĉ se per malmulto, kio certe ebligos al ni organizi pli bonan teamon kaj konkurson kiu reprezentos nin kiel vi kaj ĉiuj aliaj esperantistoj de la mondo meritas. 


Ĉar Esperanto Valoras... 

Kion ni bezonas kaj kion vi ricevos. 

- Reprezentantojn de TEFA en diversaj mondregionoj, lokanojn kiuj helpos pri detaloj rilate la organizadon kaj ludantojn kiuj partoprenos en la UK-oj dum kiuj oni organizos la matĉojn. (Kompreneble ili devas flue paroli Esperanton.)

Monon por: 

- La organizado kaj koordinado de eventoj (ne estas facile kontakti aliajn teamojn kaj konsenti ludi matĉon en la urbo kie oni organizas la UK-on). Ni estis bonŝancaj kun la teamo kontraŭ kiu ni ludos ĉi-jare, sed verŝajne ne estos tiel la sekvajn jarojn. 

- Flugbiletoj por la trejnistoj kaj ludantoj kiuj apogis nin dekomence sed ne povas pagi la tutan prezon de la flugbileto. Aliĝo kaj manĝo dum la kongresoj, (bonŝance kelkaj ludantoj kaj la trejnisto de la selektitaro jam havas sian flugbileton por la ĉijara UK), sed ni ankorau bezonas helpon. Ni petas helpon ankau de UEA.

- pilkoj, konusoj, fajfiloj ktp kiel trejnelementoj

- kontraktado de tri juĝistoj (kondiĉo por la oficialigo de la matcxoj).

- La sportvestoj de la ludantoj, T-ĉemizoj kaj aliaj rilataj varoj por la apogantoj.

Se vi volas aĉeti t-ĉemizojn, jen la disponeblaj dimensioj:

XS = Infanoj

S =  Por alteco: 1,56 - 1,67cm (64 kg. proks).
        5´10´´ - 5´48´´ (140 funtoj proks.)

M = 1,67 - 175 cm (72 kg. proks.)
       5´48´´ - 5´74´´ (158 funtoj proks.)

L = 1,75 - 1,80 cm (78 kg. proks.)
      5´74´´ - 5´90´´ (172 funtoj proks.)

XL = 1,80 - 1,85 cm (84 kg. proks.)
         5´90´´ - 6´07´´ (185 funtoj proks)

XXL = 1,85 aŭ pli 91 kg. aŭ pli
            6´07´´ aŭ pli (200 funtoj aŭ pli)

Fine de ĉiu jaro ni konigos la enspezojn kaj elspezojn de TEFA.

Kompreneble, de la kolektita mono ni investos, nek unu euro restos en la poŝoj de iu kiel profito, la eventualan plusan sumon oni gardos por la organizado kaj koordinado de la sekvaj aventuroj de la selektitaro.

La influenco de la projekto en Esperantujo

Ni kredas ke la fakto ke Esperanto havas sian propran futbalselektitaron helpos al la movado iĝi pli populara en la mondo, kreante scivolemon kaj simpation en multaj homoj, kaj eble eĉ igi ilin eklerni la plej utilan kaj interesan lingvon de la mondo. Ni jam konas tri personojn kiuj eklernis Esperanton kaj submetiĝos al la KER-ekzameno en Lillo, nur por povi esti anoj de nia selektitaro. Ni vidas nur avantaĝojn por Esperantujo, tra la pasio, populareco,  sportumado, internacia amikeco, amuzado, sana konkurado, ebleco por unuiĝi, festumado, motivado, ktp. 

Se vi havas demandojn aŭ proponojn, bonvolu kontaktu nin tefa.esperanto@gmail.com

Ni elkore antaŭdankas vin pro via kontribuo.
"La TEFA Teamo".

story:
Short Summary

  • To introduce myself, my name is Michael Hines I am a 30 year old military veteran and served in Operation Iraq Freedom.
  • My campaign is to bring a dream to life with the GlowBox. There are tons of products that glow in the dark but now here is a  convenient way to recharge any glow in the dark items. This product is near and dear to me because I have invested a lot of time into this and I will not stop until this dream is a reality.
  • Contributors will help me turn GlowBox into a worldwide brand by contributing and purchasing one of the perks.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am trying to raise $100,000 by receiving contributions and by offering perks. The money will be used to purchase in turn will mark the beginning stages of GlowBox becoming a global brand.
  • The perks that are being offered on my campaign are unique designs that shows my creative side. 
  • If the goal is not reached the funds contributed will be used to purchase as well.

The Impact

The impact you will make by contributing to my campaign is giving me the opportunity to start an amazing journey with the GlowBox brand.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is to get enough orders and contributions to have this introduced into the world. Since there virtually no major risks the perks will have a guaranteed 30 day turnaround after the campaign ends

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially you can always contribute by spreading the word using the indiegogo share tools.

To introduce myself, my name is Michael Hines I am a 30 year old military veteran and served in Operation Iraq Freedom.
My campaign is to bring a dream to life with the GlowBox. There are tons of products that glow in the dark but now here is a  convenient way to recharge any glow in the dark items. This product is near and dear to me because I have invested a lot of time into this and I will not stop until this dream is a reality.
Contributors will help me turn GlowBox into a worldwide brand by contributing and purchasing one of the perks.

The perks that are being offered on my campaign are unique designs that shows my creative side. 
If the goal is not reached the funds contributed will be used to purchase as well.

story:
Introduction

"OUCH" ...as quick as you read this; that's how fast an accident happens. Imagine how it feels to get a finger cut with stainless steel surgical grade shears or from kitchen cutlery. This is what happens on a daily basis. Everyday an accident occurs with shears or a knife. Some are more severe than the other and some require a visit to the emergency room. This is why Cosmo Finger Guard was created. Our patented designs cover the vital areas of the hand, the index and middle finger as well as the knuckles where the accidents usually happen. We are piece of mind while using shears, knives or razors. The use applications are endless! Our campaign is to launch new styles of specialty safety gloves early 2016 that are unique, fun and can be personalized. Our product is very important. We know this because we have created value for the next generation of users with Safety and Fashion in Mind.  Accidents happen and injuries are no fun. Down time, workers compensation and a possible visit to the emergency room are all too real. Your contribution will keep us on the leading edge of becoming the beauty, home and kitchen industries premier specialty Safety Glove Company.


            Patented & Patent Pending Cut Resistant Safety Gloves   

Our cut resistant gloves are made with the latest materials available today, UHMWPE Ultra High Molecular Weight Polyethylene a cut resistant synthetic yarn. This is same materials used in police and military body armor.  Our gloves also contain Alphasan which is antimicrobial, making our gloves germ resistant.

Our patent designs are based on the needs of the person wearing them. The Cosmetology glove is a two finger half palm design; first of its kind on the market. All of our gloves are rated at cut resistant level 4 of 5 by ANSI, the American National Standards Institute who measures cut resistance levels of all gloves on the market. 

Our gloves are soft, easy to use and can be soaked in any sanitizing solution or bleached. We offer them in multiple colors and also offer custom embroidering to make our gloves more personable, giving them a fashion sense.                                    




         Meet founder John McKee (right) and business partner Troy McDaniel

Cosmo Finger Guard was originally designed for Hairstylists and Barbers. Now we are entering into new markets such as for Nail Technicians, Kitchen and Home Use. Watch for our new AsSeenOnTV Infomercials airing in early 2016.



                                     Meet the Cosmo Glove Team                  

                           



                            "Examples: Finger Cut Injuries are no fun"


            Video message from Cosmetologist Extraordinaire "Gabrielle"



What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $20,000 to be used to launch our new line of gloves which will be available in multiple colors and size for our new unique designs. All of our products can be personalize with our embroidering option.

We have been selected by AsSeenOnTV-Pro for infomercials on a National and Regional TV campaign scheduled for the first quarter 2016.  So we need your help! We will offer a limited amount of reward perks including back stage filming passes.  

We will exhibit in the largest beauty Show in America, Americas Beauty Show in March 2016.  This show in Chicago plans for 65,000 attendees.  Our campaign reward perks include tickets to this event a CosmoGlove and an opportunity for photos with the CosmoGlove Team.

What we need:

  • New branded packaging

  • Inventory to support our business growth

  • Introduce two new styles of specialty gloves

Your help can make all of this possible and make another American Dream Come True. See our rewards/perks for more details and more selections.

                               

                        

      

  A few of Our Next Generation Customers & Visit The Photo Gallery for More



                                             A Video Demonstration:

                               Wear the CosmoGlove and be Safe...
                 


Risks and challenges

Risks and challenges

1) Cosmo Finger Guard is a safety product and the first of its kind in design and is manufactured using quality cut resistant synthetic yarns and materials from various resources; shipment of the various materials may potentially run into delays but is not expected. Our manufacturing facility is U.S. based but could have a delay in delivery time due to limited machinery that is not like the ones making a regular 5 finger glove. This is a specific one of a kind machine because of our unique design. We will keep all of our contributors updated should this become a problem.

2) John McKee has regular communication to the manufacturing facility for the last 3 years so the backers can be updated on the manufacturing progress accordingly if need be.

3) While our CosmoGlove team puts in its utmost effort in ensuring that the gloves are shipped on time, the shipping efficiency of local postal services at various countries are largely out of our control.


This is the most important part and we need your help. Without your support we will have to delay our progress. Your contribution will make a difference. We save hands and fingers and make it fun.
 
  

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love it if you could help share our campaign on your social media sites. You can use #CosmoGlove. Thank you very much.

-The Cosmo Finger Guard Team

Email: info@cosmofingerguard.com

manufacturing facility is U.S. based but could have a delay in delivery time due
to limited machinery that is not like the ones making a regular 5 finger glove.
This is a specific one of a kind machine because of our unique design. We will
keep all of our contributors updated should this become a problem.
2) John McKee has regular
communication to the manufacturing facility for the last 3 years so the backers
can be updated on the manufacturing progress accordingly if need be.
3) While our CosmoGlove team puts in
its utmost effort in ensuring that the gloves are shipped on time, the shipping
efficiency of local postal services at various countries are largely out of our
control.

This is the most important part and we need your help. Without your support we will have to delay our progress. Your contribution will make a difference. We save hands and fingers and make it fun.     Other Ways You Can Help We would love it if you could help share our campaign on your social media sites. You can use #CosmoGlove. Thank you very much.
-The Cosmo Finger Guard Team
Email: info@cosmofingerguard.com

story:
-----

Amid the heat of North Carolina in July, six cars line up for one of the heat races for the Global Rallycross Championship round at the Dirt Track at Charlotte Motor Speedway. A lady in black crosses to the center of the start line and holds up a simple sign: 30. Thirty seconds to the start. She waits a bit, then flips the sign around and gives one more wave in front of the drivers: 10. Ten seconds, walking off, 9, 8, 7, the drivers anticipating the start. After those ten seconds come the lights: a sequence of five red lights, one after the other, the illumination of which causes the field of cars to stop sounding like cars and start sounding like something resembling Satan's popcorn machine. The crackling and backfiring continues until the red lights cease, and a set of green lights unleashes 3500 horsepower--six cars as much power as thirty of their showroom-floor siblings.

As the cars moved off the small patch of pavement onto the dirt and clay that made up most of the rest of the circuit, the two Subaru Imprezas of Sverre Isachsen and Bucky Lasek pulled ahead from their front row starting positions and bore toward the inside part of the first corner, with Lasek converging on the other front row starter, Patrik Sandell. Sandell, trying to hold his Ford Fiesta's position against the charging Volkswagen Polo of Tanner Foust, was bumped by both Foust and Lasek, sending him straight into the water-filled barrier on the inside of the turn. Sandell's car was lodged in the barriers, forcing the officials to stop the race to remove the crippled car. With the Swede irritated and his car disabled, then, the race was restarted with the space between Isachsen and Lasek empty.

As the green lights came on to start the race, Isachsen pulled ahead, with Lasek behind. Once again, Lasek moved inside, once again Lasek found another car--this time Foust--and once again the car found the barrier. This time, however, Foust continued, despite hitting both the obstacle and immediately being collided into by the Ford of rookie Austin Dyne. As the cars continued to complete the first lap of the heat, the barrier sat in the middle of the track, in an even more prone position than Sandell's car earlier. Above the racing surface, in the press box, the status of the race puzzled some of the press corps, accustomed to the stock car and sprint car races that run at the speedway complex the rest of the season. In any other form of racing, the race would have either been slowed or stopped by this point. Series media director Chris Leone reassured the booth that this was not the case: "This is rallycross. We don't believe in yellow flags."

Sure enough, the battle for the lead--with Isachsen being hounded by the Ford of 2013 Lites class winner Joni Wiman--had to go through the mangled barrier and the trail of debris surrounding it, with Lasek getting a piece of the action a couple seconds later to ensure that every car in the heat had hit the now-useless lump of plastic. This is rallycross: a form of racing that has existed in one form or another in Europe for decades. At its most basic form, in the "folkraces" of Scandinavia, it really is a borderline demolition derby involving past-their-prime road cars. In greater Europe, though, it was developed as made-for-TV entertainment: an all-star motorsports filler product, combining drivers in pavement racing and dirt rallies.

Stateside, rallycross started as such, but in both cause and effect has become potentially something bigger: a bellwether for not just motorsport, but the whole relationship between sport and commercialism and culture. This is rallycross: a genre of motor racing imported to America as part of the premier showcase for youth-oriented action sports that has sustained a hold on the under-30 demographic to such a degree that, five and a half years after first being contested, more manufacturers, sponsors, and racing teams are looking to get involved as the championship itself successfully spreads its wings from the ESPN mothership from which it was spawned.

This budding success story is as much about favorable conditions outside the sport as it is about the people inside the series who have turned it from a niche event in a festival of niche events into the only racing series running a full schedule on broadcast television; a racing series with more manufacturer representation than NASCAR; a racing series with a more functional track for young drivers to ascend to the top; and a racing series that attracts star power the likes of which other series can scarcely match. This is rallycross: a victory of quality over quantity, a series with just over a dozen full-time drivers and a relative skeleton crew in charge, but with any one of those drivers having a shot at winning, and the series becoming increasingly influential with every move made.

The Global Rallycross Championship has evolved; whereas every race except the X Games round in 2012 was supporting either a NASCAR or Indycar race, by 2015 the entire championship schedule is a series of 12 main events, no longer playing second fiddle to any other racers. As the 2015 season approaches, the series stands at the starting line in as great a position as ever to win over the racing public and put their mark on the automotive world once and for all. This is rallycross: fresher than NASCAR, more relevant than Formula One, and poised to take advantage of both series' missteps and vault into the limelight.

-----

The Global Rallycross Championship represents a major intersection in American culture: at a point when mainstream automotive journalists fret over the loss of interest in the younger "Millenial" generation in cars, the series aims squarely at them by doing everything that mainstream series like NASCAR and Indycar don't: use real, practical cars (well they start off that way) in short heat races on diverse, mixed-surface courses. It's not simply "go fast and turn left", but left, right, and a bit of up and down as well. The result: in just five years, the series has a national TV deal, a title sponsorship with Red Bull, the involvement of four manufacturers (and counting!), and the interest of the whole racing world.

About the author

Lenny Sundahl is a West Virginia-based sportswriter who got his first taste of rallycross last season for his Speed Smorgasbord motorsport blog. For 2015, he's looking bigger, aiming to cover the whole season for a book-length project. It's a bit of a haul, though: from his home in West Virginia, half the season are flyaway races. The target funding goal would cover travel costs including airfare, hotel stays, and ground travel for the whole 12-race calendar as well as the GRC-organized X-Games rallycross invitational. 
note: above pictures from the official Red Bull Global Rallycross gallery

story:
The Invisibo Timeline

Hey Everyone - a quick update to give some more insights into what our timeline looks like. I hope everyone is ready for some Invisible fun!

What We Are Trying To Do

SEX….everybody loves it, everybody does it - BUT let’s face it, the traditional latex condom is getting a bit long in the tooth. This is an industry that is begging for a revolution - Invisibo is here you give you that revolution.

There are the obvious reasons that call for a drastic change in they need improvement:

  • Awkward moments while you fumble around with it
  • They're not very comfortable to put on
  • Intimate acts are not as pleasurable
  • Sizing confusion - who knows how they size these… big, small, extra small?
  • Not hygienic, leaving you a fun clean up after

Finally, there is an Answer!




Why Would You Want Them?

While there is really no limit to what you can do with Invisibo's, we've outlined a few reasons why you might want them:

  • Give them as gifts and raise your gift giving cred to an all time high
  • For your significant other - make it a gift that you can BOTH enjoy
  • For yourself - sometimes you just need some ME time :)


Risks & Challenges

While there may be some risks and challenges involved to bring about a revolution this big, there's really only ONE thing that matters:

  • Ensuring that we do not run out of orders!!

story:
About Vodka T-Shirts

We developed a passion for making Premium quality T-Shirts. On our trips all over the country, we were always frustrated by the lack of offerings. Big-brand retailers sold formless T-Shirts and luxury brands charged exorbitant prices. It seemed like there was a real need for a brand that focused on great fit and superb quality, all at a reasonable price. That’s where “Vodka T-Shirt” was born. Our T-Shirts are made with 100% Premium cotton and Bio-washed, using state of the art technology & machinery in the industry.

Today, we are headquartered in a small but creative office in the close proximity to knitwear city and loving every minute of making our Vodka T-Shirts. We source our fabric from Tiruppur and processing done from there only. Tiruppur is also known as the "knitwear capital" of India, accounting for 90% of India's cotton knitwear export. All the top International brands are manufactured here.

We hope you adore our work. Our goal is to build a brand grounded in our core values of great fit and superb quality. We truly appreciate you getting involved.

Corporate social responsibility

It has always been an honest endeavour for Angal to give back to society. We firmly believe in inclusive growth through social entrepreneurship. In other words, it is important for an enterprise to empower the weaker sections of society. We also believe in giving back to nature because nature is the main source of our functioning.

 

How can you help us in making a better world?

We strive to make sure that your help reach’s the needful. On a single press of a buy-button, you can bring change to the life of someone. The product of choice is of course yours but you also get to buy another product at a subsidised cost. The fund generated will be used mainly to empower the weaker sections of society because the country can only make progress if all sections of society such as women, children and the poor are empowered. This was said by none other than ‘Mahatma Gandhi’.


Fall in love with the soft texture as you wear this regular-fit Bio-Wash T-shirt, from the house of VODKA INC. Your skin will love the feel of this T-shirt as it is fashioned using cotton rich fabric. Available in five colours (Red, Dark Green, Navy Blue, Yellow &White) and in six different sizes (S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXXL)

story:
{WHO WE ARE}

Hi everyone!
We're Marcela Lucia and Liz Montecastro. We originally met in San Francisco in 2009 and connected over being Fine-Art-turned-Fashion-Design students. After completing design school, we both found ourselves in different aspects of the fashion industry. Marcela left for New York where she worked in knitwear for an up and coming designer, and specialized in print design for Betsey Johnson. Liz moved back home to Los Angeles where she began contributing fashion articles to LA Weekly while freelance wardrobe styling for music videos and local fashion companies.
We kept in close touch with each other and finally reconnected when Marcela relocated to LA in 2014. Through the drive and entrepreneurial spirit that we recognized in each other, we realized it only made sense to join forces and work together. Since then, we have been collaborating to create the business of our dreams - our very own swimwear brand.


{WHAT WE'RE DOING}

We're taking a new design approach to swimwear and we're really excited to share everything with you when the collection drops for Spring/Summer 2016! What we can tell you for now is that in each season, our line will include limited-edition swim pieces designed exclusively by us and handmade locally here in downtown Los Angeles. Collaborating within our community of artists, we are excited to feature original prints created especially for us. Since the concept of collaboration is such an important aspect to our brand, custom orders will also be available! We want to make our pieces as much about you as they are about us.

This project goes beyond just creating a  fashion brand with a swimsuit line. This is about empowering each other as females in business.  This is about creating our dreams together while collaborating with our community and creating work that everyone can be proud of. This is about supporting our local economy by sourcing all our fabrics and producing our garments right here in downtown LA. And those points are only the beginning.

A preview of our custom-designed printed fabric for our Spring/Summer '16 collection.

One of our handmade custom-order swimsuits featuring our original marble print.


{HERE'S THE BREAKDOWN} 

In order to launch our swimwear line, we need to put our first season into production - and we want you to be a part of the beginning with us! Here's a breakdown of what your donations will go towards: 

$3000 - Full production run with custom materials, all sourced locally in downtown LA
$500 - Business licensing and website consulting
$500 - Lookbook photoshoot production to include models, photographer, and location



{OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP}
We totally understand if you are not able to make a monetary donation! Help us spread the word! We encourage you to share our campaign with your friends, co-workers, and family. Every little bit helps!

For updates and sneak peeks of our brand, make sure to follow us on Instagram @LaversLawLabel!


Thank you so much for your support.

story:
Long Story Short

Design is my passion.  Since I was 5 years old, I have only ever been sure of one thing -- that I was going to be an artist.  After graduating from design school and working for design firms in San Francisco and New York City; I began searching for a way that I could express my own design voice, instead of those of my bosses.  I found my voice in product design and launched my brand in 2013 with my Amethyst NYC SkyKat handmade pillow line, the first of three lines to be featured in editorials on Houzz.com.
     Despite these achievements, my self-funded brand struggles to get the exposure that it needs to thrive.  I believe that a booth at the International Contemporary Furniture Fair in New York City can change that -- allowing me to reach designers and retailers from every corner of the globe.  More exposure = more orders. Higher volume orders would allow me to continue to introduce new products, order materials in bulk (effectively reducing the price of my products), and to pursue my dreams full time.

What We Need & What You Get

I have set a design goal of $5500.  This would cover the cost of a 5x10 booth at ICFF, hotel accommodations for my time there, and a little left over to help with the cost of stocking the booth.


In exchange for your help, I have put together some great perks for your donation:

  • $25 -- save 25% on your next order from zachmitchellinteriors.com!
  • $50 -- Color-dipped polycanvas tote featuring our embroidered giraffe logo and name! Open main compartment. Pen loop. 12" handle drop height.
  • $100 -- 18" Amethyst SkyKat Pillow.
  • $500 -- 18" Amethyst SkyKat Pillow, 18" Metallic Gold Courage Pillow, Metallic Gold Designer Photo Mats.

If we do not reach the goal of $5500, all funds raised will be put toward product development and local (less expensive) trade shows.  No funds acquired through this campaign will be used for non-business purposes.

The Big Picture

Right now, this is a one man operation.  The long term goal is to grow the business large enough that I can open a brick-and-mortar shop with staff on both the sales/retail side, and the manufacturing side.  That starts with orders from designers, retailers, and everyday consumers like you!


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the funds to donate?  That's okay!  You can still help by spreading the word about the handmade products at zachmitchellinteriors.com.  Ask local retailers to carry Zach Mitchell Interiors products. Like us on facebook, follow us on instagram (@zaxmitchell) and look for our products at The Shop in East Liberty (Pittsburgh, PA)

story:
Our Goal

  • We're looking forward to create a brand for wood cases.
  • its important for us to make it in luxury way.
  • this is the start of our project and thank you for your support to make it happen.
  • Indiegogo users getting a special and limited price now. So don't be late


Retail Price : 35$

Next step 

We will make it in a professional way so if we get the target, next step will be amazing. we're looking forward to :
  • Create a web site which you can upload any photo to be printed on a wood
  • Cases will be also for laptops and desktops 


Risks & Challenges

In our country there is no support for technical projects so it means a lot for us if we did it here.

  • Having the right machines is too difficult and expensive on middle east countries.

What we need

After you support us to reach the target. you will provide us :

  • Your mobile brand and model.
  • If you choose the limited design edition you have to send us any logo and we will make a special design for you
  • If you choose custom photo printed you have to provide us a photo which will be printed on the case

story:
IN THE BEGINNING...

VOLI: prints on silk is going to the STYLIST LIVE fashion event in London in October! Showcasing two collections, VOLI: prints on silk will be making its debut in London at a four day life style and fashion fair. Sitting alongside Givenchy, Swarovski, and Clarins this independant small label will be mixing it with the big guns. Want to see the little guy achieve his dreams? Help the designer, Pete Volich, creative director of VOLI: prints on silk get to London in October.

 

Australian actress Leeanna Walsman wears VOLI: prints on silk


MY PRODUCT

VOLI: prints on silk is a new label of wearable prints.  

 I am an artist and designer currently living in Split, Croatia but originally from Australia. I have been exhibiting and creating photography, collage and printmaking for the past fifteen years in Australia, the UK and Europe. Since relocating to Croatia I wanted to find an avenue to make my artwork more accessible, I was inspired by the history of the Croatian Cravat, and decided to create a label where the sentiment of strong women, discovery, transition and freedom was at the core of my label. I started the label in November 2014 and since then have started selling in Australia through Ray Costarella, an Australian designer, in his shop POST EMPORIUM in Perth, Australia. 

My label is a very small affair, it is only me, designing, marketing, distributing, like many other first time designers. I want to use this platform to reach people who want to support the emerging vision of a designer who could use a leg up, to showcase their talent within a bigger playing field, and grow my business, designing unique and beautiful scarves selling to a broader market. 

All of my scarves are printed on 100% silk by a state of the art printing company Think Positive Design. All designs and photography are made by me. The scarves are editioned and only have a print run of 100 for each design so they are very unique. The feel, quality, craftsmanship, and packaging of every scarf is sublime.

http://www.thinkpositiveprints.com/



HAPPY CUSTOMERS

"I come with over 25 years of experience in costume and props depts for film and television, my life is consumed with stories and how they are visually interpreted.

What I love most about Pete Volich's 'Voli' scarves is that each one is a mystical, wearable fairy tale. 

Pete's photography is hauntingly beautiful and combined with his use of glorious silk as his medium the scarves become sumptuous wearable art. They feel absolutely divine against the skin and there's something quite magical in the knowing that there's such deep meaning behind each one. I'm a big fan and very much looking forward to what's to come so I can add them to my growing library of 'Voli'”

Lisa Javelin, Sydney, Blogger, Stylist, Costume and Props extraordinaire 

“I've been a fan of Pete Volich for many years. He has an incredible talent and creates the most magical narratives through his camera and eye.  His transition into prints on silk, under the label Voli, is a wonderful - and logical - extension of his arts practice. I have a huge collection of silk scarves... I always say they can jazz up any old outfit. I'm also a fan of photography -  I work at a photographic agency in London and I have a small but growing collection of photographic artworks. So for me, the Voli scarf collection is very special. I wear my Peacocks in a dramatic flourish around my neck... it's a conversation starter, a real show-stopper. It's a beautiful print and I love the story behind it” @EmmaPhillips, London

 

THE EVENT

SYLIST MAGAZINE is a free weekly magazine for women in the UK that showcases up coming trends in fashion, restaurants, beauty products, and events. The STYLIST LIVE event is the first large scale event being held in Islington London, it will bring together designers, food, catwalks, books, and key note lectures from celebrity chefs Nigella Lawson, and Lorraine Pascal, along with appearances from Salman Rushdie to name a few. There will aslo be 100 pop up stores which will include VOLI: prints on silk, its first launch into the London fashion world occuring over four days in October 15-18 2015. The opportunity for exposure to department stores is huge!

http://live.stylist.co.uk/

 

GIVING BACK

VOLI: prints on silk will be donating 10% of every sale at the SYLIST LIVE event to a Breast Cancer charity . This is close to my heart, in 1997 I lost a very dear friend and mother figure to breast cancer. VOLI: prints on silk creates scarves that empower women, scarves that are unique, inspire individuality, and confidence. By giving back to this valuble cause, in my small way, I also want to highlight the need for more donations that go to helping women now, providing help and inspiring hope to those affected by breast cancer through early detection, education, and support services.  Scarves play an important role with people living with cancer, I want to be able to offer women suffering from the effects of treatment an opportunity to dress and accessorise themselves with a beautiful, artisan, garment.

After I complete my own crowdfunding campaign I will be volunteering my time to give a workshop about crowd funding to HELP a non government organisation in Split that provides assistance, workshops, and education to at risk teenagers. They provide education on drug awareness, sex education, and give free workshops to teach people skills to find jobs and empower them. I want to use the skills I have learnt from having my own crowd funding campaign to help a worthy cause.

https://www.facebook.com/udrugahelp?ref=hl

http://www.helponline.hr/


YOUR MONEY

All pledges are very much appreciated and every person who donates money will have their name mentioned within a wallpaper design that will feature in my stand at the STYLIST LIVE event. There are also some pretty impressive kick backs for pledging your hard earned cash! Your money is going towards:

-       Getting me to London - Flights, travel and accommodation expenses

-       Printing my new collection FLOSSY

-       Paying for the rent of the stand

     Install and design of my stand

     works in progress from the new collection FLOSSY - watercolour studies that are available for PERKS when donating.


see other beautiful dedication photographs I have made for people on

https://instagram.com/petevolich/

story:
My name is Josiah Brown,  I'm 12 years old. My brother's name is Micaiah Brown and he is 10 years old. We are just ordinary kids that love to have fun.

We put this campaign together to receive your support in our new and very exciting  product. It's a very simple idea. We know many sneakers  already come with lights built in them. But we just discovered a simple and easy  way to put lights on any of your sneakers and have fun at the same time.

Today when you make your contribution, you will be helping us get our company off the ground. We are happy that it's a small investment for you to get our Sneaker Lights,  but it's a big deal for us because with your help we can achieve our goals.  

 

 

Right now at this point we have spent money on general business expenses. (Website design, Hosting, prototypes, mock up designs, production and a few other small expenses)

We need

- to pay for molds/tooling for our products to be manufactured. 

- to pay for packaging and supplies.

- to pay for our first shipment of products.

- to cover our budget for a well planned marketing push.

There are a few other things we would need in the course of running our business, your contribution today will help us move forward.

 

Your contribution to this campaign is so important to us:

  1. With your help we can be successful.
  2. Your contribution helps us be even more confident in pursuing our goals to grow this company.
  3. With out your help, we will fall short!

 

 

We may be young but we have a strong team behind us. Our parents and older brothers are very active in the development and progress of this business. No need to worry about your investment in us. We are dedicated to delivering to you a quality product.

 

 

With our design complete, we are working close with our product developer to deliver exactly what we envisioned for our brand. As a backer of this project, we will keep you up to date every step of the way.

Please make sure you like our FaceBook Fan Page http://facebook.com/sneakerlights

 

 

If for any reason you are not able to help us reach our goal today. We simply ask that you do whatever you can do to spread the word!

story:
FUNDING Adora Tote, a taste of Italy


Designed in NY, handcrafted in Tuscany. A sustainable brand supporting family owned
manufactures.




SHORT SUMMARY

 

I am Tuscan born and raised, and when my job brought me to NYC I realized US is missing out on something big: excellent leathercrafts at a fair price. 

Americans only have access to Made-In-Italy artisanal products when they are sold - and overpriced - by the big names of fashion. But the same artisans that work for the luxury industry also craft their own private label, which, having no export channel, only remains accessible in some local stores in Italy.

Adora is a direct-to-consumer brand coming straight from the artisans’ manufactures in Vinci (Tuscany), cutting all middlemen and luxury industry markups by allowing Italian family-owned businesses to access the US market directly.



 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

 

We are funding a new batch of Adora for Summer 2018:

1. For the family-owned manufactures

The Adora project stands for the undiscovered Artisans of Italy, who deserve to be known for their own creations, without disappearing inside the big brands they usually are forced to work for. Adora employs them at fair terms, so that they don’t have to become a mass-production workforce for the dominant players. On the opposite, they can maintain their high-quality standards by producing only small batches of bags at the time, constantly throughout the year, while the fashion industry forces them to mass-produce seasonally with long periods of inactivity in the middle.



2. For a sustainable fashion industry

The production model of Adora is entirely sustainable: all materials employed are actually result of the over-production commanded to the tanneries by the luxury industry.

Artisans will source the best leather in the world, from the tanneries of Santa Croce Sull’Arno (Tuscany). Products will be ready for delivery in approximately 10 weeks. An unusual time for fashion accessories? In this era of fast fashion, it is. But we respect the long hours demanded by the traditional manufacturing techniques that craftsmen employ for Adora, as we do not wish to compromise the quality of a millenary heritage, passed down in the family of makers generation after generation.


THE IMPACT

Since 2014, over 1200 Adora have travelled from the artisans’ labs in Vinci (Tuscany) to all over the world.

We had hundreds of reviews on The Purse Blog only, by fashion influencers an fashion experts, but more importantly, by women using Adora in their daily life.

In 2014, an all-women team of New York fashion connoisseurs came together to design Adora. They all had a completely different background – from CEO to Creative Director to Working Mum blogging about style - and they joined forces to design a bag that would be able to meet ALL their needs for daily life in the city.

Adora is crafted in robust premium Tuscan leather, in order to be able to carry everything from Macbook, to make-up case, to gym weights.

But ladies will be ladies, and if there is one thing that a Manhattan-girl will never give up, it’s style. That’s why Adora was designed to look beautiful when it’s bursting with stuff, but also when it’s elegantly folded in a teardrop shape for carrying only a lipstick and a pair of keys.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


This project goes way beyond money for us. If you can’t help with a donation, sharing Adora with your friends will be just as precious. There is a whole world of undiscovered craftsmen in Italy that deserves to be known for their beautiful creations, without disappearing behind a logo!

story:
AVAILABLE COLORS

 

 

STRETCH GOAL COLORS

 

 

The Mini Penny is the world's first convertible, modular luxury bag for women! Traditional luxury bags are expensive, costing hundreds or thousands of USD and only offer one look. The Mini Penny is here to give women what they've always wanted: a luxury bag that is affordable & high-quality and will dress up to them! 

 

 

 

 

 

CORE FEATURES

 

  • Modular Bag Design – Mix & match to create multiple looks for your OOTD
  • High Quality Materials – Genuine Italian leather, premium fabrics, and YKK zippers
  • Convertible - 4 different ways to carry the Mini Penny
  • Adaptable - Why pay hundreds or thousands to get a luxury bag that will eventually go out of style? The Mini Penny can adapt and reflect the latest trends.

 

 

WHAT SETS THE MINI PENNY APART?

 

When we created the Mini Penny, there were 3 issues that we wanted to solve.

  • Luxury bags cost hundreds or thousands of USD. Bags are usually marked up 5x-50x the manufacturer cost to cover the high cost of middle men, brick & mortar store locations, and expensive ad campaigns. 
  • Bags have only one look and cannot be changed. Is your bag out of style or do you want a different color/style? Too bad. You'll have to go buy another bag and dish out more money. Also, many bags are not convertible and can be carried only one way.
  • Expensive bag collections are hard to travel with. It's hard to fit multiple bags into your luggage without damaging them or ruining their shape.

The Mini Penny addresses all of these issues. The Mini Penny:

  • Supports dozens of looks with modular design & convertible. The Mini Penny allows for your bag to mix & match with an endless number of styles. It is also convertible.
  • Has no huge markup to cover production & marketing costs. We sell online directly to our customers. Our savings are reflected in the price tag.
  • Packs easily and is ultra lightweight. You can pack a dozen looks into your suitcase with one Mini Penny bag and it only weighs a little over 1lb/0.45kg.

We're here to disrupt the fashion industry and we need your support to accomplish that. You can make a difference!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

MATCH WITH YOUR OUTFIT OF THE DAY

 

 

 

HOLLYWOOD SUPPORTERS

 

The Mini Penny has started to get some support in Hollywood. Members of the Stranger Things cast and The Voice have taken a liking to our bag and will be wearing them on the set and at promotional events soon!

 

 

WHY WE ARE PUTTING OUR OWN MONEY ON THE LINE

 

We believe in the potential of the Mini Penny and Penny Heart (our minibag is just the beginning) and we are serious about following up on every one of our promises. A lot of campaigns want to rely on money from backers to cover everything. That is not us. To us, nothing shows dedication more clearly than putting in your own money and that is exactly what we are doing. We've already funded the prototype and now we are covering the majority of the cost of our first production run. We are proud to be a bootstrapped independent studio and we would not be able to do that without the support of our amazing community! 

So where do you come in? Why do we need money from IndieGoGo backers?

  • We're putting in our own money to cover the majority of material cost and manufacturing fees for the first production run. We still need more to cover all 4 bag colors and, if we hit our stretch goals, maybe even 6 colors.
  • Custom metal hardware. We need to make the final molds for production. They are expensive, running about $800-$2500 each.

 

STRETCH GOAL COLORS

 

 

If we manage to exceed either of these funding goals, the corresponding additional color will become available for all perks.

1. Over $30,000 - Baby Blue color becomes available

2. Over $40,000 - Pastel Pink color becomes available

 

 

We’re Pen & Vince, a wife & husband team from the US & Taiwan. We both share a deep passion for creative design and bags. We’ve spent the past decade working as designers for top film, AR/VR, & entertainment companies. We've spent many years working with manufacturers in the tech & entertainment industry. Now we are applying our skill & creativity to the fashion industry. 

Penny Heart was founded when Pen began having difficulty traveling with her nicer bags. Her luggage was always fully packed to the allowed weight limit and she became worried about her handbags getting damaged, having their shape ruined, or getting stolen/lost. Since designer bags are so expensive and we could not afford to buy more of them, Pen was very protective of the ones she had. While traveling for leisure or work, she wanted to bring a few of her nicer bags with her, so she could have multiple looks abroad. However, no matter how strong our luggage was, the airlines always found a way to crack, damage, or lose them entirely. This made both of us lament that designer bags had to be so expensive. Pen would gladly buy more bags from these companies if they were more affordable. Why do women have to pay out so much just to express themselves?

We felt there had to be a better way and sat down to sketch out some ideas. Thus, the Mini Penny and Penny Heart were born. It took 2 years of research and travel, but we have our bag design finalized and our suppliers and manufacturers lined up. All that's left is to find the  first supporters that believe in us and what we are trying to build. 

 

Penny Heart and the Mini Penny were named after Pen by Vince. Penny is her nickname and "I Heart Penny" became Penny Heart. 

We can’t thank you enough for your support! You are helping us launch Penny Heart and without you that wouldn't be possible.

 

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

 

The biggest risks are delivery time, Duty/VAT, and Customs. While we will do everything in our power to prevent it from happening, there's always a risk that our suppliers may not fulfill on time, affecting delivery time. As a result, we've added some buffer into our delivery time estimate to account for this possibility. For VAT - If you live outside of the US, Australia, Singapore, or Hong Kong, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. Lastly, regarding customs, some countries are very slow with customs. If you live in one of those countries (if you live in one you are probably aware), prepare for the possibility of a delay.

We'll update everyone frequently about our progress, and if there are any issues along the way, you'll definitely know about them!

 

REFERRAL PROGRAM

 

Even if you can't contribute with money at this time, you can still help our campaign succeed by sharing. Besides helping us launch Penny Heart, we want to motivate you by giving you the opportunity to win FREE Mini Penny bags. Here are some ways you can win: 

1. Bring in $150 of backing = FREE Keychain Charm 

2. Bring in $1,000 of backing = also receive FREE Mini Penny x1 Perk 

3. Bring in $2,500 of backing = also receive FREE Mini Penny x1 Perk + Keychain Charm

4. Bring in $5,000 of backing = also receive FREE Mini Penny x2 Perk + x2 Keychain Charm

Here's how you can easily share out to others:

1. Method 1: Click these share buttons to share quickly.

Share our campaign link wherever you think people will be interested. You can share on social sites, blogs, friends/family, FB groups, etc. The more you share, the greater your chance of success! 

2. Use IndieGoGo's Share Tools located at the top of our page.

The bar at the top of our campaign page. 

3. Login your IndieGoGo account, and go to our campaign page. Copy the link with the number at the end. That’s your unique referral marker. 

Paste that link to anywhere with large viewership. Your email lists, FB groups, Linkedin groups, personal blogs, forums, or anywhere else where people might be interested to know about our campaign. 

We want to promote our brand to more people and your referrals and recommendations to others are extremely helpful in accomplishing this goal. We know this requires a good deal of effort on your part and we value your time, so that's why we are offering a reward.

 

FAQ

 

1. Do you offer vegan leather for the flaps & straps?

Not at this time. We do plan to produce vegan flap & straps after our first production run.

2. When will the bags ship?

We will begin shipping in late August and early September, so your bags should arrive just in time for fall and well before the Holidays hit.

3. Why are your bags priced so cheaply? Are you using cheaper materials?

Nope. We use only the best leather, fabrics, and metal that are available. Our materials are better than those used by some of the top luxury brands & come from some of the best suppliers in the world. The difference is that we are not bogged down with a large corporation and do have to cover the cost of stores, middle men, and advertising campaigns. We also are not greedy and we are intentionally not marking our prices highly as most other fashion companies would. If our bags came out of the factory with a luxury brand name on them, they would instantly cost at least 3x our full retail price. 

4. Where are your bags made?

Our leather and fabric materials are shipped directly from our suppliers in Italy. Our bags are assembled in Hong Kong with a manufacturer that makes bags for Tumi, Coach, Michael Kors, and Tory Burch. Their craftsmanship is stellar and they are proven. 

5. How do I get my Order ID?

You can find your Order ID by logging into your Indiegogo account and clicking on ‘My Contribution’.

6. What is the warranty policy if I receive a defective Mini Penny?

We value our backers, and we blieve in the quality of our bags. If there is a problem due to a manufacturer's defect, we will replace your Mini Penny.

7.  Are you planning to offer more colors soon?

Color choice and style variety are both essential to the Mini Penny's chances of success. If we are able to hit our stretch goals, we will have 6 colors at launch. Within the year, we hope to release 2-4 new colors and flap/strap sets each season.

8. Are these the final bags?

The bags shown in our Indiegogo images are all prototype bags. The final bag that ships will look the same, but will have more luxurious metal hardware.
story_txt:
AVAILABLE COLORS
 


 
STRETCH GOAL COLORS
 

 
The Mini Penny is the world's first convertible, modular luxury bag for women! Traditional luxury bags are expensive, costing hundreds or thousands of USD and only offer one look. The Mini Penny is here to give women what they've always wanted: a luxury bag that is affordable & high-quality and will dress up to them! 
 
 
 


 
 
CORE FEATURES
 


Modular Bag Design – Mix & match to create multiple looks for your OOTD

High Quality Materials – Genuine Italian leather, premium fabrics, and YKK zippers

Convertible - 4 different ways to carry the Mini Penny

Adaptable - Why pay hundreds or thousands to get a luxury bag that will eventually go out of style? The Mini Penny can adapt and reflect the latest trends.

 

 
WHAT SETS THE MINI PENNY APART?
 
When we created the Mini Penny, there were 3 issues that we wanted to solve.


Luxury bags cost hundreds or thousands of USD. Bags are usually marked up 5x-50x the manufacturer cost to cover the high cost of middle men, brick & mortar store locations, and expensive ad campaigns. 

Bags have only one look and cannot be changed. Is your bag out of style or do you want a different color/style? Too bad. You'll have to go buy another bag and dish out more money. Also, many bags are not convertible and can be carried only one way.

Expensive bag collections are hard to travel with. It's hard to fit multiple bags into your luggage without damaging them or ruining their shape.

The Mini Penny addresses all of these issues. The Mini Penny:


Supports dozens of looks with modular design & convertible. The Mini Penny allows for your bag to mix & match with an endless number of styles. It is also convertible.

Has no huge markup to cover production & marketing costs. We sell online directly to our customers. Our savings are reflected in the price tag.

Packs easily and is ultra lightweight. You can pack a dozen looks into your suitcase with one Mini Penny bag and it only weighs a little over 1lb/0.45kg.

We're here to disrupt the fashion industry and we need your support to accomplish that. You can make a difference!

 
 

 

 

 

 
 

 


   
 
MATCH WITH YOUR OUTFIT OF THE DAY
 



 
 
HOLLYWOOD SUPPORTERS
 
The Mini Penny has started to get some support in Hollywood. Members of the Stranger Things cast and The Voice have taken a liking to our bag and will be wearing them on the set and at promotional events soon!
 

 

WHY WE ARE PUTTING OUR OWN MONEY ON THE LINE
 
We believe in the potential of the Mini Penny and Penny Heart (our minibag is just the beginning) and we are serious about following up on every one of our promises. A lot of campaigns want to rely on money from backers to cover everything. That is not us. To us, nothing shows dedication more clearly than putting in your own money and that is exactly what we are doing. We've already funded the prototype and now we are covering the majority of the cost of our first production run. We are proud to be a bootstrapped independent studio and we would not be able to do that without the support of our amazing community! 
So where do you come in? Why do we need money from IndieGoGo backers?


We're putting in our own money to cover the majority of material cost and manufacturing fees for the first production run. We still need more to cover all 4 bag colors and, if we hit our stretch goals, maybe even 6 colors.

Custom metal hardware. We need to make the final molds for production. They are expensive, running about $800-$2500 each.


 
STRETCH GOAL COLORS
 

 
If we manage to exceed either of these funding goals, the corresponding additional color will become available for all perks.
1. Over $30,000 - Baby Blue color becomes available
2. Over $40,000 - Pastel Pink color becomes available
 

 

We’re Pen & Vince, a wife & husband team from the US & Taiwan. We both share a deep passion for creative design and bags. We’ve spent the past decade working as designers for top film, AR/VR, & entertainment companies. We've spent many years working with manufacturers in the tech & entertainment industry. Now we are applying our skill & creativity to the fashion industry. 
Penny Heart was founded when Pen began having difficulty traveling with her nicer bags. Her luggage was always fully packed to the allowed weight limit and she became worried about her handbags getting damaged, having their shape ruined, or getting stolen/lost. Since designer bags are so expensive and we could not afford to buy more of them, Pen was very protective of the ones she had. While traveling for leisure or work, she wanted to bring a few of her nicer bags with her, so she could have multiple looks abroad. However, no matter how strong our luggage was, the airlines always found a way to crack, damage, or lose them entirely. This made both of us lament that designer bags had to be so expensive. Pen would gladly buy more bags from these companies if they were more affordable. Why do women have to pay out so much just to express themselves? 
We felt there had to be a better way and sat down to sketch out some ideas. Thus, the Mini Penny and Penny Heart were born. It took 2 years of research and travel, but we have our bag design finalized and our suppliers and manufacturers lined up. All that's left is to find the  first supporters that believe in us and what we are trying to build. 
 

Penny Heart and the Mini Penny were named after Pen by Vince. Penny is her nickname and "I Heart Penny" became Penny Heart. 
We can’t thank you enough for your support! You are helping us launch Penny Heart and without you that wouldn't be possible.
 
 

RISKS & CHALLENGES
 
The biggest risks are delivery time, Duty/VAT, and Customs. While we will do everything in our power to prevent it from happening, there's always a risk that our suppliers may not fulfill on time, affecting delivery time. As a result, we've added some buffer into our delivery time estimate to account for this possibility. For VAT - If you live outside of the US, Australia, Singapore, or Hong Kong, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. Lastly, regarding customs, some countries are very slow with customs. If you live in one of those countries (if you live in one you are probably aware), prepare for the possibility of a delay.
We'll update everyone frequently about our progress, and if there are any issues along the way, you'll definitely know about them!
 

REFERRAL PROGRAM
 

Even if you can't contribute with money at this time, you can still help our campaign succeed by sharing. Besides helping us launch Penny Heart, we want to motivate you by giving you the opportunity to win FREE Mini Penny bags. Here are some ways you can win: 
1. Bring in $150 of backing = FREE Keychain Charm 
2. Bring in $1,000 of backing = also receive FREE Mini Penny x1 Perk 
3. Bring in $2,500 of backing = also receive FREE Mini Penny x1 Perk + Keychain Charm
4. Bring in $5,000 of backing = also receive FREE Mini Penny x2 Perk + x2 Keychain Charm

If our bags came out of the factory with a luxury brand name on them, they would instantly cost at least 3x our full retail price. 4. Our bags are assembled in Hong Kong with a manufacturer that makes bags for Tumi, Coach, Michael Kors, and Tory Burch. story:
HURLER2

The HURLER2 is the World's Best & Easiest to use Sporting Clay Thrower.   We are launching this exciting new product in January 2017.  To date we have already manufactured a first run which enabled us to move into product testing.  This product has been tested by numerous people in the hunting and skeet shooting industries.   It continues to WOW everyone that puts one in their hands because it is so easy to use.  It's easy to use, easy to carry with you and very durable.

The Safety Orange and CAMO HURLER2 is the World’s easiest to use clay target thrower. No big machines to haul around. No electricity to hook up. The most durable clay target thrower you will find. 

Load up either one or two 4 1/2″ clay targets and start having fun. With our patent pending Pistol Grip you will enjoy hours of fun throwing and shooting clay targets. Never a fear of it slipping out of your hand. No twisting around in your hand. Very easy to throw double targets.  

The HURLER2 is easy to assemble for either left hand or right hand throwing. You can also adjust the slider for clay target spread. No tools required to assemble. No machines or electrical parts. 

100% made out of plastic and extremely durable with a LIFETIME GUARANTEE.

ADVANTAGES  

  • Extremely durable
  • Throw single or doubles
  • Adjust for spread of clays
  • Perfect distance
  • Simple to put together
  • Adjust to throw right handed or left handed
  • Easy adjustments
  • No machines or electrical parts
  • Weatherproof 
  • Easy to carry
  • Uses standard 4 ½” clays
  • Limited Lifetime Guarantee

By contributing to this campaign you will assist us in launching this product and you will be one of the very first to own your HURLER2 before it hits the marketplace.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to fund this launch.  The monies will be used for such things as packaging, enhancement to the website, marketing and more.

We've outlined the PERKS you will receive on the following sections.  Plus you will be part of the FOUNDING GROUP of HURLER2 users.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can help us through the PERKS but you can certainly assist us by getting the word out to those who may be interested in this product.  Help us make noise and create awareness.  Go to Indiegogo share tools.

story:
WHY WE CREATED WRISTMATE?

Smartwatches have become more than just functional and innovative.  Now, makers strategically create a collection to select and suit our individual styles.  But, the desire to own the entire suite is very costly.  Personalization is also limited to changing straps and bands.  For many that engage in active lifestyle, smartwatches still require enhanced protection.  Fast technology easily out-trends device aesthetics.  Craving for newness, means buying every new launches. This is why Wristbrain created Wristmate. 

OUR VALUE PROPOSITION

Wristmate is a premium case and strap system for your smartwatch that allows you to build your own collection & protection.  Whichever way you want,  without breaking the bank.

Wristmate not only lets you customize straps and bands, but case and bezels too.  So you can make your smartwatch even more personal in any event you participate in.  Anytime you need to!

WRISTMATE’S DIFFERENTIATOR

Wristmate is the first true mate for your smartwatch. It is a product of artistry applied in engineering. It is designed from the ground up, respecting the original smartwatch design quality.  Others approach their product design as a component of an existing case assembly.  Wristmate’s design methodology starts by re-engineering the whole case and strap system.  Then making sure each component seamlessly complement the overall design language.

PRODUCT LINES 

Wristmate currently comes in three variants to get you started.

SHIELD – is the rugged, masculine, military-grade line for extreme outdoor activities.

GAME – is the sporty variant that lets you play with colors to match your sport.

LUSH –  is the choice if you wish to look elegant and glamorous in a special event

PERKS


PRICE COMPARISON FOR SIMILAR SYSTEMS

PRODUCT FEATURES

  • Highly fashionable – allows you to match various fashion profiles, colors, and trends

  • Interchangeable - easy-to-swap case and strap system


  • Delightful protection – protects and enhances smartwatch aesthetics

  • Made of premium materials



MECHANICAL SPECIFICATIONS


PREMIUM QUALITY, MATERIALS & FINISHES

The cases are forged and CNC-machined so every detail can be executed precisely.  Tremendous effort and concurrent engineering were undertaken to ensure the manufacturer understands the design & engineering requirements fully.  Then the appropriate fabrication processes are identified and agreed.  This achieves perfect execution while minimizing scrap loses, thus cost.

MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS


WHY TRUST WRISTBRAIN?

Designing, engineering and manufacturing products are our passion.  We had been doing this for global companies for years.  However,  the desire of eventually making our own products had always been at the back of our minds.  This drove us to form the team of artists, engineers, innovators, developers, manufacturers and visionaries. So we can freely utilize our talents, skills and experience, to inspire people, create opportunities and change lives.

Our core competencies include product execution, supply chain management and manufacturing innovation.


STATUS AND TIMELINE

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP?

To make Wristmate a reality, we need to commence production tooling development. But this means paying for tools and fixtures  and high volume material order. This is where we need your support. And we need you to be part of it. Together, we can make it happen!

WHERE WILL THE FUNDS GO

RISKS AND CHALLENGES
With the number of product variants and customization options available for Wristmate, initial market demand forecast is unpredictable. 
However, in order to mitigate such level of demand uncertainty, we've made sure that our supplier will have enough raw materials, resources and flexible line setup allotted for Wristmate products. 
Although, the overall goal of Wristmate is to have as much customization options as possible, we've initially limit the number of styles to a manageable level. This is to ensure you get your Wristmate on time at the highest quality.
THE TEAM

story:
About this project

First of all I want to say thank you so much for reading my campaign page here on INDIEGOGO. I'd like to give you a bit more of my history so you can better understand where SLIM42 came from. An Italian Master-Craftsman's Answer to the Modern Age

My name is Andrea Palama and as a watch craftsman of 25 years I set myself a goal of creating a unique set of watches for the modern age. I wanted these watches to spark curiosity, be comfortable and still maintain that air of style that I love about Italian timepieces.

Our on-the-go lifestyle means most watches are ignored today, but SLIM-42 will get you noticed and may spark a conversation. I hope you like what I've created as much as I've enjoyed making them, and I hope together we can make SLIM-42 come to life.

Hope to see you join our project!

The SLIM42 CLASSIC

I had a lot of fun with this one. Don't want a watch that conforms to social norms? Want something that's completely different and can't help but pop out at you. Say hello to the SLIM42 classic. Shirt / Jeans / Suit, you make the rules.

The SLIM42 classics is also made of very high quality Polycarbonate (the same used in the iPhone, HTC and Sony Smartphones). It's just as thin as the SLIM42 Steel but this one also incredibly light.


SLIM42 CLASSIC IS SUPER SOFT



The SLIM42-BAND

Okay I couldn't help myself, I had to add in a little more style. So with the SLIM42 Band, I took the same designs of the SLIM42 Classic but added in a customizable chain link band.




enjoy here our 3d watch interactive just move your mouse in :)


MANUFACTURING

The super serious stuff ... this is where the SLIM42 will come to life and this is why we need your help.

assembly screws on case back

Our Assembly Room Floor

Our CNC Line

We have a policy of testing our products meticulously and our prototype came back perfect

The Waterproof Testing Area every watch will test one by one in order to give to our Backers top quality.

REWARDS

Please select a reward for any watches for the collection.You'll receive a survey to specify the model later Thanks.

Rewards For who like get 2 watch.

We offer 2 watch for just €55  available for 50 set only ,and can choose any combination of colors.

So why are we here?

Okay so me and my team have done the hard work of designing the SLIM42 and building prototypes. But now we need your help to get to our manufacturers minimum order size so we can get SLIM42 out into the world and you can enjoy your own SLIM42.

We hope you'll join us on our journey and get your own SLIM42 at an incredible price ... just for you, our lovely backers.

Help us by sharing the SLIM42 with your friends please! and get one gift from us , fill the form here www.ideacreationgroup.com/gift  and you will get with your order this additional adjustable soft bracelet for free THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT.


                                                                     Gift Baracelet


Know someone who would be just excited by the SLIM42? Reach them with our campaign via the "Share this project"


SLIM42 FEATURES and SPECIFICATIONS

Our 2 Years warranty covers your watch breaking for any reason! In addition to covering manufacturer's defects, it also covers , water damage, or a broken band. All you have to do is ship the broken watch back to us and we'll send you a replacement right away! The warranty does not cover wear & tear on a working watch or a dead battery.

SLIM42 Classic Specifications

 SLIM42-BAND Polycarbonate Specifications


PACKAGING

SINGLE PACKAGING If You choose 1 - 3 - or 5 pieces pledge, your watches will each in this single package



CRATE PACKAGING If you choose 10 pieces you will receive this crate with your ten watches of the styles and colors you choose



 About The Designer

• First of all I want to say thank you so much for reading my campaign page here on Kickstarter. I'd like to give you a bit more of my history so you can better understand where SLIM42 came from.

• My name is Ippazio Andrea Palama and I’m an Italian Watch Designer since 1991. I was born in 1963 in Italy and spent most of my youth in Rome where I developed my love of style and watches, and I where I later went on to studied the art of design at the Academy.

• After working as an assistant in numerous design studios. I started my own career as a freelance designer in 1991 and it was in this year that I came up with my first passionate creation for the watchmaking sector. After spending more than a year designing and producing this model, I decided to set up my own distribution company and working very hard I established myself in the market.

• In 1996 I was awarded the Best Award Design at the Gallery of Design and Innovation in New York.

• In 1997 my work with computerized graphics led to an international prize, the Best Combination Site, an award given by Media Magazine and Apple Inc. for the creation of an original website

• In 2000 I decided to design a collection with very original shapes and, this time, in an explosion of colors and new materials. My new collections met with great success at international trade fairs and gave me the opportunity to design watches for various leading brands. HERE if You like You can see some of my design creations.

• 2003 with the creation of a second brand, COOL, I began a unique application of color and plastic materials to the design of watches and small jewelry. I partnered with Champion in 2005, one of the leaders in the Brazilian Market and our watch is still strong in the Market

• 2010 I finally created my brand ANDREA PALAMA & PALAMASIX3 and develop the brand for 5 years. SLIM42 is my latest creation. 

Our Timeline

For design, manufacturing, prototyping, campaigning, production and fulfillment of the collection.



OUR KICKSTARTER HISTORY

The project was fully funded within the first 10 DAY with 136 BACKERS


I would like to extend my sincere thanks for your interest in SLIM42 which has been 5 years in the making.

My very best wish and a big hug

Andrea Palama

In order to realize this Campaign i want to say Thank you to everyone who is working hard with me to make this dream a realty! Thanks Guys!!

Francesco Cardullo – cofounder, dreamer, making things happen  

Jerry Wu – Prototype developer

Walter Haas – Consultant

Special Thanks For the video  Lucas, Leo, Diana, Milica, Danka, Valentina, Rich, DJ Jack.

Our manufacturers stand ready to activate production as soon as we meet our Indiegogo funding goal.

We will always keep you informed if (in the rare chance) things take longer than planned.

Risks and challenges:

The main risks are our reliance on outside sources within the supply chain. The contractor for the manufacturing of the flex circuit has to order components from other vendors. If one of these vendors slips in a commitment, the timing of the production process is at risk, but we're confident that with our long experience, local relations and attention to quality assurance, we'll meet or beat our projected delivery dates.
